areaDescription: Shards of obsidian arch over shattered mosaic floors, their surfaces slick with perpetual condensation and faintly pulsing with deep violet light; every footstep echoes through the vast, angular halls, disturbed by a chorus of whispers that seem to rise from the very stones, hinting at volatile magics and the restless remnants of Calamyr’s final hour.

locations.name: Shattered Throne Chamber
locations.description: A vast, echoing chamber with fractured obsidian arches rising over a shattered mosaic floor. Each tessera glints with a faint, pulsing violet gleam, and condensation weeps from the stone. The air is thick with ancient whispers, and a fractured throne of black stone sits atop a dais, its back etched with cryptic runes and scorched by wild magic. Crumbling statuary and tattered banners hint at the doomed city's lost grandeur.

npcs.name: Archivist Lareth
npcs.description: A hunched, spectral figure draped in shimmering, translucent robes. Archivist Lareth guards the histories of Calamyr, a memory given form, endlessly muttering half-forgotten secrets.
npcs.attitude: Wary but eager to share knowledge in exchange for memories or rare truths.

monsters.name: Echo Wraiths (2)
monsters.description: Insidious spirits bound to the throne, swirling with fragments of memory and magical residue.

lootTable: Crown of the Last Regent (Headband of Intellect, requires attunement and whispers memories in dreams)
Obsidian Shard Scepter (as a +1 rod, acts as arcane focus)
Scroll of Legend Lore (fragmentary, requires piecing together in Lareth's presence)
plotHooks: Lareth cryptically hints at a hidden reliquary somewhere below the throne—if the party can decipher the mosaic's puzzle.
A fragment of a key needed to unlock the final chamber of Calamyr is fused into the throne, visible only under dim violet light.
locations.dmInstructions: Lean into the oppressive atmosphere—describe the whispers, the shifting shadows, and the sense of time frozen at the moment of Calamyr's fall. Archivist Lareth offers lore or riddles but becomes hostile if the throne is defaced. Scale the Echo Wraiths for a two-character, level 8 party.

doors.name: East Door
doors.description: A fractured stone door engraved with faded runes, obsidian inlay forming sigils.

doors.name: West Door
doors.description: A tall archway covered by a tattered banner, leading deeper into the ruins.

dcChecks: Arcana DC 15: Recognize the runes on the throne as wards against intrusion.
Investigation DC 16: Discern the puzzle in the mosaic relates to a secret compartment beneath the throne.
History DC 14: Identify the banners as belonging to Calamyr's last defenders.
locations.accessibility: Normal access; entry requires passing through guarded halls.

features.name: Dust
features.description: Thick, silvery dust carpets the floor, disturbed only by spectral movement and the party's entry.

features.name: Interesting Architecture
features.description: Obsidian arches and fractured pillars create strange acoustics, amplifying whispers and stifling other sound.

features.name: Scorched Mosaic
features.description: A grand floor mosaic depicting Calamyr's rise and fall, now warped by magical destruction.

encounters.name: Throne Spirits
encounters.description: Upon disturbing the throne or attempting to solve the mosaic puzzle, two Echo Wraiths emerge.

encounters.name: Archivist Lareth
encounters.description: Willing to parley, Lareth offers cryptic assistance or answers one question in exchange for a precious memory (roleplay opportunity).

locations.adventureSummary: The Throne Room is the psychic and magical heart of Calamyr's tragedy, offering both danger and vital information for those who dare engage with its guardian spirit.

locations.name: Grand Gallery
locations.description: A grand, high-ceilinged gallery lined with obsidian columns. Shattered banners hang limply, their sigils nearly lost to mold and time. The air pulses with a faint, nauseating thrum, and footsteps echo with unnatural clarity. Fine cracks run up and down the walls, seeping faint violet light. The hall feels like it is waiting to be disturbed.

monsters.name: Obsidian Sentinel
monsters.description: A hulking statue animated by unstable magic, shaped like a guardian knight with a cracked visor and a violet core.

lootTable: Amulet of Shielding (grants resistance to force damage, requires attunement)
A page torn from the Journal of the Last Queen (cryptic clue to the reliquary's location)
plotHooks: A hidden panel in one column contains a map fragment revealing a secret passage accessible from Chamber R06.
The hall's magical resonance intensifies in the presence of specific runes found elsewhere—players can experiment to unlock hidden alcoves.
locations.dmInstructions: The Obsidian Sentinel only animates if characters approach the banners or spend time examining the columns. Allow for stealth or roleplay avoidance, but combat can become deadly if players draw attention in more than one location.

doors.name: North Archway
doors.description: A wide arch flanked by cracked columns, leading to Corridor R04.

doors.name: South Door
doors.description: A reinforced wooden door with intricate ironwork, warped but intact.

doors.name: West Door
doors.description: A battered obsidian door, chipped and scorched.

dcChecks: Perception DC 14: Notice the shifting of a loose stone in one column.
Investigation DC 15: Find the concealed map fragment in the hidden panel.
Arcana DC 16: Sense the magical resonance fluctuates, possibly responding to the party's presence.
locations.accessibility: Normal access; entry is usually not restricted, but the southern door may impede progress.

features.name: Support Columns
features.description: Tall obsidian pillars, some cracked and oozing faint violet light.

features.name: High Ceiling
features.description: Ceiling vanishes into shadow, occasionally pierced by shafts of spectral light.

features.name: Banners
features.description: Tattered, colorless banners bearing the faded heraldry of Calamyr.

encounters.name: Obsidian Sentinel
encounters.description: Animates if party disturbs the banners or columns.

locations.adventureSummary: A critical junction in the ruins, Hall R02 tests the party's ability to spot hidden opportunities and deal with magically animated threats.

locations.name: Weeping Corridor
locations.description: A narrow, dim corridor lined with cracked obsidian tiles and flickering sconces. The air is humid; water drips steadily from the ceiling, forming shallow puddles. Shallow grooves cut across the floor, and the ever-present whispers grow more insistent here.

monsters.name: Scuttling Shadows (3)
monsters.description: Quasi-corporeal vermin, remnants of magical experiments gone awry; quick, insidious, and hostile to intruders.

lootTable: Obsidian Talisman (worth 50 gp, radiates faint abjuration magic)
Vial of Residual Ether (can be used for one spell component requiring rare essence)
plotHooks: The grooves in the floor suggest a mechanism controlling a secret door in Chamber R06.
A scratched symbol in the wall matches one seen in a mural in the throne room, hinting at interconnected traps.
locations.dmInstructions: The pressure plate trap is hidden amidst the grooves. Make clear when players are investigating the floor; reward clever solutions to avoid or disable the trap. The Scuttling Shadows attack from hiding if the trap is triggered or the party lingers.

doors.name: North End
doors.description: An open archway with sconce-lit recesses leading back to Hall R02.

traps.name: Simple Pressure Plate
traps.description: A hidden pressure plate that triggers when stepped on.

dcChecks: Perception DC 15: Notice a slight shift in the floor tiles.
Investigation DC 14: Recognize that the grooves align with the pressure plate trigger.
Stealth DC 13: Move slowly enough to avoid triggering the trap.
locations.accessibility: Normal access, though hazardous due to the pressure plate trap.

features.name: Cracks In Walls
features.description: Jagged cracks radiate from floor to ceiling, some emitting faint magical light.

features.name: Sconces
features.description: Flickering, ghostly blue flames burn in the wall sconces, never extinguishing.

encounters.name: Scuttling Shadows
encounters.description: Ambush if trap is triggered or party lingers.

locations.adventureSummary: Corridor R03 serves as a tense, trap-laden passage where the party must balance caution and speed under spectral pressure.

locations.name: Mosaic Corridor
locations.description: A broad corridor with mosaic fragments embedded in the floor and walls. Faded tapestries drip from rusted hooks, their scenes distorted. The walls are veined with thin cracks, and the air is heavy with the scent of damp stone. Echoes seem to linger too long here, sometimes overlapping with words the party didn't speak.

monsters.name: Haunted Tapestry Wraith
monsters.description: A spirit bound to the ancient tapestries, manifesting as a shifting, semi-corporeal figure woven of ragged threads and memory.

lootTable: Silver-threaded Tapestry Fragment (worth 75 gp, resonates gently in moonlight)
Potion of Mind Shielding (advantage on saving throws vs. being frightened for 1 hour)
plotHooks: The tapestry depicts a ritual that once protected Calamyr; deciphering it may grant clues to bypassing magical wards in the throne room.
A hidden alcove behind one tapestry contains an inscription revealing the password to a door in Chamber R06.
locations.dmInstructions: Let players interact with the tapestries—studying or repairing them can reveal lore or even calm the bound spirit. The corridor can be bypassed stealthily, but the spirit attacks if relics are disturbed.

doors.name: West Archway
doors.description: A simple stone arch, partly blocked by fallen rubble, leading back to Hall R02.

dcChecks: Religion DC 13: Recognize the ritual depicted is meant to ward against spirits.
Perception DC 15: Discover the alcove behind the largest tapestry.
Insight DC 12: Sense that the echoes are not natural, but magical leftovers.
locations.accessibility: Normal access, though passage is hindered by rubble.

features.name: Tapestries
features.description: Ancient, heavy tapestries depicting Calamyr's royal court, now faded and torn.

features.name: Cracks In Walls
features.description: Spiderweb cracks fill the masonry, some pulsing faintly with residual magic.

encounters.name: Haunted Tapestry Wraith
encounters.description: Manifests if tapestries are disturbed or the party lingers too long.

locations.adventureSummary: Corridor R04 encourages exploration and offers critical lore, but its ghostly guardian punishes disrespect or haste.

locations.name: Ceremonial Hall
locations.description: A majestic hallway illuminated by crooked chandeliers that emit violet-tinted light. The walls are lined with faded banners showing Calamyr's lost heraldry. The floor is slick with condensation, and the air pulses with the memory of ancient ceremonies. The end of the hall bears a mural scorched by magical backlash.

monsters.name: Calamyrian Boneguard
monsters.description: Animated suit of ceremonial armor, encrusted with gemstones and ancient sigils, rises to defend the hall.

lootTable: Ceremonial Gemmed Dagger (worth 100 gp, may be used as a spell component)
Torn Page: Ritual of Suppression (can be pieced together with notes from other chambers)
plotHooks: A mural at the end of the hall reveals a hidden lever, which if activated, opens a secret passage in Chamber R06.
The chandelier's magical mechanism can be disabled, dimming the whole hall and revealing hidden runes.
locations.dmInstructions: The Boneguard animates if the party approaches the mural or attempts to remove the ceremonial dagger. Give clues that the chandelier is more than decoration to encourage investigation.

doors.name: East Door
doors.description: An ornate double door with tarnished silver filigree, leading to the Throne Room.

doors.name: West Door
doors.description: A narrow, reinforced door, partially concealed by a banner, leading to Chamber R06.

dcChecks: Perception DC 13: Notice the runes beneath the chandelier's light.
Investigation DC 15: Find the hidden lever in the mural.
Arcana DC 15: Recognize the chandelier's magical origins.
locations.accessibility: Normal access, but passage west is blocked unless the lever is found.

features.name: Chandeliers
features.description: Twisted, silver chandeliers flicker with unnatural violet flames.

features.name: Banners
features.description: Tattered banners line the walls, their heraldry unrecognizable.

features.name: Scorched Mural
features.description: A once-majestic mural, blackened by magical fire, now obscures a secret mechanism.

encounters.name: Calamyrian Boneguard
encounters.description: Animates if the mural is approached or the dagger is disturbed.

locations.adventureSummary: Hall R05 is a ceremonial nexus, harboring a powerful guardian and secrets crucial to deeper exploration.

locations.name: Sanctum of Last Resort
locations.description: An ominous chamber lined with intricate wall engravings and decorated with grim relics. The floor is damp, and subtle magical runes trace the periphery. The air here is heavier, as if thick with regret. This chamber once served as a sanctum of last resort.

npcs.name: Captain Veylan
npcs.description: A battle-scarred, spectral mercenary captain, clad in battered armor and carrying the weight of a failed last defense. He is tormented, torn between duty and the curse binding him.
npcs.attitude: Grimly determined to test intruders, but may be reasoned with by those who honor the fallen.

monsters.name: Lesser Calamyrian Wights (2)
monsters.description: Restless dead bound by the chamber's curse, emerging from alcoves if the sanctum is violated.

lootTable: Key Fragment of Calamyr (needed to access the deepest reliquary)
Captain's Insignia (badge of office, can command spectral sentries elsewhere)
Sealed Parchment (contains the password for a magical ward in the throne room)
plotHooks: Defeating or appeasing Captain Veylan grants the party the Key Fragment and vital information about the final chamber.
The wall engravings contain hints to the curse's origin and Calamyr's last stand.
locations.dmInstructions: Present multiple solutions: players can battle, outwit, or honorably bargain with Captain Veylan. If players previously found clues or the password from Corridor R04, they gain advantage in negotiations.

doors.name: East Secret Door
doors.description: A seamless panel disguised with intricate carvings, can only be opened by activating a hidden lever in Hall R05 or by solving the mural's puzzle.
doors.trap: If forced, unleashes a pulse of necrotic energy (2d8 necrotic damage, DC 15 Con save for half).

traps.name: Simple Pressure Plate
traps.description: A hidden pressure plate that triggers when stepped on.

dcChecks: History DC 15: Read the wall engravings to learn the story of Calamyr's final hours.
Persuasion DC 16: Appease Captain Veylan through an oath or remembrance.
Perception DC 14: Spot the outline of the secret door in the carvings.
locations.accessibility: Normal access from Hall R05 once the secret door is found; otherwise, requires solving multiple clues.

features.name: Wall Decorations
features.description: Elaborate reliefs show the doomed defenders of Calamyr standing against an encroaching darkness.

features.name: Runic Perimeter
features.description: Subtle magical runes pulse with faint violet light, hinting at lingering protective magic.

encounters.name: Captain Veylan's Challenge
encounters.description: Party must defeat, outwit, or appease Captain Veylan. The wights only join if violence erupts.

locations.adventureSummary: Chamber R06 is both a final test of strength and compassion, holding the key fragment and truths needed to unlock Calamyr's deepest secrets.
